front.title: SDP Offer/Answer for RTP over QUIC (RoQ)

abstract.t: This document describes several new SDP "proto" and "attribute-name" attribute values in the "Session Description Protocol (SDP) Parameters" IANA registry that can be used to describe QUIC transport for RTP and RTCP packets, and describes how SDP Offer/Answer can be used to set up an RTP connection using QUIC as a transport protocol. These new values are necessary to allow the use of QUIC as an underlying transport protocol for RTP applications that commonly use SDP as a session signaling protocol to set up RTP connections, such as SIP and WebRTC. This document also contains non-normative guidance for implementers.
